comments.author: cygan
comments.body: Quote from: Agrawas on January 13, 2023, 02:56:16 PM✂Send u a pm few days ago with all the outstanding coldkeys pending for shipment and the loan pending from yogg.this is first and foremost about the users who were stolen from last night (cest) by yogg

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.created_time: January 13, 2023, 03:53:04 PMLast edit: January 14, 2023, 02:11:55 AM by PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on January 13, 2023, 03:09:38 PMQuote from: Agrawas on January 13, 2023, 02:56:16 PM✂Send u a pm few days ago with all the outstanding coldkeys pending for shipment and the loan pending from yogg.this is first and foremost about the users who were stolen from last night (cest) by yoggNot to be a downer, but even if by some miracle my swept funds (.0125 btc) were returned to me, that is a merely a small % of what was actually stolen. I am not btc rich. I buy btc to buy collectibles. I spent somewhere around $800 (also believe this auction was a steal - and seller originally paid much more) for that set which is now practically worthless. Putting a BTC figure on this based solely on what is swept is less than 1/3 of what was actually lost - conservative estimate as this same release sold for near $1200 to Yoda. Literally impossible to be made whole and I’d prefer Yogg’s damage is not diminished by being valued by what he stole. What he really did is so much worse - especially to you Cygan and to the forum members that have supported him for years. Such quality work - all destroyed Edit: I actually thought this was a post of gathering information - not of Cygan fixing part of it. Kind of unreal to get anything back and gives me a newfound respect for Cygan

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: PreciousMetapsICT on January 13, 2023, 03:53:04 PMNot to be a downer, but even if by some miracle my swept funds (.0125 btc) were returned to me, that is a merely a small % of what was actually stolen. I am not btc rich. I buy btc to buy collectibles. I spent somewhere around $800 (also believe this auction was a steal - and seller originally paid much more) for that set which is now practically worthless. Putting a BTC figure on this based solely on what is swept is less than 1/3 of what was actually lost - conservative estimate as this same release sold for near $1200 to Yoda. Literally impossible to be made whole and I’d prefer Yogg’s damage is not diminished by being valued by what he stole. What he really did is so much worse - especially to you Cygan and to the forum members that have supported him for years. Such quality work - all destroyed This is true, and I'm very sorry to everyone as well. Yogg was what I thought was a good friend. he stole from me as well. I feel guilt for even helping him resurrect this project now even, but how could I have known?  Anyhow, to get anything back at all in cases like this is the best you can possibly hope for/get... Most times, scam victims never get a dime back, this is better than nothing, but I feel your pain. I lost about 20k overnight all told... Poof... Sorry again all, and thanks to the guys wanting to help make things right, you are truly the best - Kialara, Frank @ Alpen, Claycast, and others I may have missed, thank you and I am sorry this space feels like it will never be the same again.  So many burns on so many levels. Not how I planned on starting a new year at all. Edit - Cygan, Thank you, but I won't be asking for a  refund for my silvers, you took a huge hit too here, and I'm not going to make it worse for you brother. Thanks to you sir, you have a heart of gold.

Did he give his explanation to owlkatz and then start sweeping more cards?!?!?maybe provide txn id to see if additional cards were also swept at the same time.

comments.author: BobbyCoins
comments.body: You should start communicating in block height of last known CK swept by yogg because of time zones... last block of stolen funds I know of was 771.616 but the info is just from this funding-transaction of Silver Halving CKs: https://mempool.space/tx/27:a1afdd4e5e667bad1c499038a3ef96d6f85f656b737c16e7addb783640b2dd31

comments.author: LitLitBit
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on January 13, 2023, 08:52:57 PMthe first refund bunch has been sent to the users listed belowCode:heistyYodasRedRocketkrogothmanhattanLitLitBittweetiousthe associated tx-ids were sent by dmtomorrow we will continue ... i'm off now Can confirm that cygan has refunded my stolen bits from both my silver and gold halving sets 0.025BTC in total. As tweetious mentioned this is such a fucked situation as I don’t know if cygan is refunding from bits paid to him from his work at coldkey or his personal bits or what’s going on. I’m thankful to recover this small portion. I’m out about ~1BTC in premiums paid for all my cards as I had 74 coldkeys in total. It’s been a devastating 48 hours.

comments.author: Mitchell
comments.body: I've just sent in my official picture proof. Cygan has offered to refund me yesterday and I would like it to be known that I've refused. Whilst I appreciate the gesture, I do not want his money. I'll gladly take the hit if the money doesn't come from Yogg's pockets.
